summary: The Farm Credit Adjustment Act allows the Farm Credit Administration (FCA) the option to examine low-risk Farm Credit System institutions every 24 months, rather than the current standard. This change is intended to streamline the examination process for institutions deemed low-risk by the FCA. The bill, introduced in the House of Representatives on August 19, 2025, amends Section 5.19(a) of the Farm Credit Act of 1971, with the amendments set to take effect on October 1, 2026.
